poem:
Title: "In Contemplation of the Smoke"

The frozen breaths of youth,
dying before birth, now coaxed
into the arms of law. 
The blow exhausts innocence,
forcing off the lips' edge; £100
the song of misguided liberty.
Rise then, Sunak, in the west,
the toll of lives and sterling
in your clenched grasp.
Time's cycle sneers; another
age added, another reason
smothered in foggy resolve.
